Tissamahānāga Thera：A monk of Kutumbiya Vihāra．Having heard the Satipatthāna Sutta from Tissa Thera of Ambalena，he was on his way back when he met a wild elephant．By his virtue the elephant was subdued and Tissamahānāga took shelter from a storm under the elephant’s body．There he developed arahantship．He then went to Viyolaka-Vihāra with the elephant，and for thirty years the animal waited on him．



After death the monk’s remains were cremated at Kutumbiya Vihāra，and the elephant participated in the celebrations．Ras．ii．185f．
